title: Hypothesis Testing Education Design in Statistics Using Gamification

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Mathematical and Statistical Concepts
context.additional_context: Aims to acquire statistical concepts and develop problem-solving skills in a gamification environment using personal devices. Students progressively learn hypothesis testing procedures through game elements and receive comprehensive evaluations of learning outcomes via project deliverables

learning_goals: Students can perform the five-step hypothesis testing process (problem definition, hypothesis formulation, significance level determination, test statistic calculation, conclusion) with 80% or higher accuracy through game-based tasks
Learners can correct errors within three attempts using gamification feedback (e.g., scores, progress bars) and improve statistical thinking
Teams present and evaluate results of applying hypothesis testing to real-world social issues (e.g., health data analysis) through project-based activities
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
